docs.abstract: The government plans to deploy new technology for next year’s head count, but risks abound.
docs.snippet: The government plans to deploy new technology for next year’s head count, but risks abound.
docs.lead_paragraph: In the run-up to the 2020 census, the government has embraced technology as never before, hoping to halt the ballooning cost of the decennial head count. For the first time, households will have the option of responding online, and field workers going door to door will be equipped with smartphones to log the information they collect.

headline.main: Hacking, Glitches, Disinformation: Why Experts Are Worried About the 2020 Census
headline.print_headline: Census at Risk From Glitches And Attackers

docs.abstract: The Swedish retailer now lets customers know where nearly every garment it sells is made. Is that enough?
docs.snippet: The Swedish retailer now lets customers know where nearly every garment it sells is made. Is that enough?
docs.lead_paragraph: The H&M group sells  an estimated three billion articles of clothing per year. Its revenue makes it among the top three fashion retailers in the world.

headline.print_headline: Do You Know Where Your H&M Sweater Is Made?

byline.original: By Elizabeth Paton and Sapna Maheshwari

docs.abstract: Spurred by advances in photomechanical reproduction, forgers are increasingly selling unauthorized copies of famous works on the internet, and elsewhere.
docs.snippet: Spurred by advances in photomechanical reproduction, forgers are increasingly selling unauthorized copies of famous works on the internet, and elsewhere.
docs.lead_paragraph: In Basel, the Swiss authorities are prosecuting a local art expert who they say sold hundreds of fake prints that he passed off online as the work of Roy Lichtenstein, Andy Warhol, Paul Klee, Pablo Picasso and others over 10 years.

headline.main: Art Experts Warn of a Surging Market in Fake Prints
headline.print_headline: Art Experts Warn Of a Surge in Fake Prints

docs.abstract: The announcement applied only to 301 websites, and many Kashmiris said they were still in an information black hole.
docs.snippet: The announcement applied only to 301 websites, and many Kashmiris said they were still in an information black hole.
docs.lead_paragraph: NEW DELHI — Months after imposing a sweeping communications blackout in Kashmir, the Indian government on Saturday unblocked several hundred websites in the disputed Himalayan region, bringing a tentative end to the world’s longest internet shutdown in a democracy.

headline.main: India Restores Some Internet Access in Kashmir After Long Shutdown

byline.original: By Kai Schultz and Sameer Yasir

docs.abstract: Just by downloading an app, you’re potentially exposing sensitive data to dozens of technology companies, ad networks, data brokers and aggregators.
docs.snippet: Just by downloading an app, you’re potentially exposing sensitive data to dozens of technology companies, ad networks, data brokers and aggregators.
docs.lead_paragraph: This article is part of a limited-run newsletter. You can sign up here.

headline.main: The Loophole That Turns Your Apps Into Spies

docs.abstract: Algorithms are sending ads by American brands onto Russian disinformation sites.
docs.snippet: Algorithms are sending ads by American brands onto Russian disinformation sites.
docs.lead_paragraph: Lenin is sometimes said to have predicted that capitalists would sell Russia the rope with which they would be hanged. Yet not even Lenin could have imagined Vladimir Putin’s success in getting some of the largest Western companies to subsidize his disinformation efforts by advertising on his government-run “news” websites.

headline.main: How Amazon, Geico and Walmart Fund Propaganda

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Russian Interference in 2016 US Elections and Ties to Trump Associates

docs.abstract: I scrolled through the photographs of the two of you, kissing hand-in-hand, the archaeology of your love pieced together in binary code.

docs.lead_paragraph: I scrolled through the photographs of the two of you, kissing hand-in-hand, the archaeology of your love pieced together in binary code.

docs.abstract: The push for quick deliveries from internet retailers has worsened gridlock and pollution. Packages are also luring thieves.
docs.snippet: The push for quick deliveries from internet retailers has worsened gridlock and pollution. Packages are also luring thieves.
docs.lead_paragraph: [Want to get New York Today by email? Here’s the sign-up.]

headline.main: 1.5 Million Packages a Day: What Your Online Ordering Does to N.Y.

docs.abstract: Package theft has also soared in cities like Denver and Washington. The increase has frustrated shoppers and led to creative measures for thwarting thieves.
docs.snippet: Package theft has also soared in cities like Denver and Washington. The increase has frustrated shoppers and led to creative measures for thwarting thieves.
docs.lead_paragraph: Online deliveries to an apartment building in northern Manhattan are left with a retired woman in 2H who watches over her neighbors’ packages to make sure nothing gets stolen.

headline.main: 90,000 Packages Disappear Daily in N.Y.C. Is Help on the Way?
headline.print_headline: Battling Thieves, When 90,000 Packages a Day Go Missing

byline.original: By Winnie Hu and Matthew Haag

docs.abstract: Representative Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez and other critics of an earlier proposal said a move to add offices in Manhattan proved them right.
docs.snippet: Representative Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez and other critics of an earlier proposal said a move to add offices in Manhattan proved them right.
docs.lead_paragraph: Amazon said on Friday that it would lease office space in Midtown Manhattan for more than 1,500 employees, increasing its presence in New York City less than a year after abandoning plans for a second headquarters in Queens in the face of stiff local opposition.

headline.main: Amazon Grows in New York, Reviving Debate Over Abandoned Queens Project
headline.print_headline: Amazon Plans Manhattan Growth And Foes of Plan for Queens Crow
